GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If there's gonna be any walkin' t'be done, I'ma gonna need transportation.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of having everything come to me rather than the reverse. I'm not really fancy to all this moving around. For %d gildar, I guess I could manage to walk one or two extra steps for you.
UnitType.Backstory: Debova is a deadbeat. You could even say she was born this way, taking her sweet time to show her face to the world, reluctant to leave the warm and protective womb, so much that her exhausted mother didn't survive the delivery. Her defining characteristic from that point on was unreliability. Always late, always penniless, constantly procrastinating and so lazy, so lazy that she could never keep a job for more than a week. When she died of the Darkling Flu, her family decided to delay her funeral. After all, she'd been late during her entire life, she could also be late for her own burial. Debova wouldn't have it that way: she rose from her coffin and lumbered to her former home to remind her family of their obligations. So lazy and yet so demanding of others. Yes, Debova is a deabeat, in every sense of the word.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If I can't make it to the top, then no one else will.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of retribution paid in blood. My life ended at the worst possible moment, redemption was just a few hours away and I lost it all. I wasn't worthy enough to ascend and I'll show everyone just how much. If you hand out %d gildar, I'll turn my hatred towards your competitors instead of you.
UnitType.Backstory: It was during her participation in the sacred pilgrimage of Khed-Al-Bhadi that Dezessera turned into one of the Walking Dead. While arduously ascending the volcanic badlands of Denjura to reach the pool of Forever Red, she lost her footing on a loose rock and fell down the mountainside, breaking her back. No one in the procession stopped to help her, for such is the rule: the road to the Forever Red must be scaled alone. One has to rise as a selfish individual and the least interaction is strictly forbidden. Once purification is achieved through zealous rites and bathing in the sacred pool, only then can the reborn individual merge into the group and descend as part of a Redeemed Ones. Quendars being so resistant to heat, the searing temperature didn't speed up Dezessera's predicament. Her agony was long and protracted. Her delirium was one of hatred and recrimination, her final thoughts a true visitation of Evil. So intense, that many days later, her dried up husk rose from her bed of sharp rocks, a dark and angry spirit full of malevolence. Yes, she would lie in wait for the next procession to the Forever Red and ambush the pilgrims, preying on their crippling individualism, the very one responsible for her own demise.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'In any cellar dank and deep, wherever there is neglect in housekeep, grows mold on every dustheap.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of molding and spreading mold. Let it take everything over, extend its fuzzy reach for a taste of all the flesh. I'll give you a taste of that sweet mildew for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: When young Millie the scullion was ordered to go fetch a few bottles of Lost Barrowhill Wine for the upcoming banquet, she interrupted her vigorous scrubbing of the grease stained cauldron and dutifully went downstairs to the cellar. And never came back. In the rush of getting everything ready on time, the harassed kitchen supervisor forgot to follow up on that order and Millie completely slipped out of her mind. On the next morning, as soon as the general call to clean up had been given, Millie's absence amongst the army of scrubbing scullions was immediately reported to the kitchen supervisor. Sorting through her foggy thoughts, she vaguely remembered the cellar and sent the first sleep deprived page passing by to bring the slacker back to work. Deciphering what exactly transpired afterwards amidst the pandemonium and brouhaha, the exaggerated testimonies and spreading wild tales, became an impossible task. The page still swears to this day to have found Millie lying prone amidst ripped potato sacks, completely covered with a strange growth of mildew. When he cautiously came closer, she suddenly rose and hissed incomprehensible gibberish. Her eyes were dead and her movements crooked. When she made a grab for him, the page ran away in panic, screaming at the top of his lungs and hitting every pillar and table corner along the way. The palace guard, who was sent to investigate, came back up empty handed and somewhat miffed at the hysterical page who lost what remained of his sanity to their insistent questioning. Millie's whereabouts remain unknown to this day and the faintest whiff of mildew can now terrorize the servants to irrational levels. Who knows what really happened down there? Suffice it to say that not all mysteries are made from the same mold.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'What do you mean by "old fossil"? I've got enough fuel to last until the next cataclysm.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life... unlife of keeping these old bones mobile enough to enjoy another ride of adventure and intrigue. Might miss a few of the earthly pleasures of the flesh but for %d gildar, I'll promise to focus on more intellectual pursuits.
UnitType.Backstory: In Casver County, mudslides frequently occur after heavy rains. During an especially strong downpour, the Tussock Hillock split in half, exposing its entrails and hidden earthen treasures. That was when Old Thalmon's tomb was pushed to the surface, its grisly contents left open to the elements. Thalmon didn't mind at first, quite content to proceed with his eternal rest, certain another mudslide would cover him up again. The rain stopped however and the sun regained its rule of the skies. Thalmon twitched when dogs came to sniff his bones but without any sweet and juicy marrow filling the insides, they quickly lost interest. When three children from the village came exploring, found his remains and spoke of carving flutes with his hollow bones and using his skull as a bongo drum, he could stand it no longer. In a surge of outrage, the scattered bones melded together and his skeleton reformed, to the screeches of the fleeing boys. That should teach them some respect! Now, how about paying his descendants a friendly visit to catch up on the latest gossip?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A true professional wouldn't let such a mundane event as dying affect the performance of his commission.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of pursuing my commission as a castellan. I ask for nothing more than to provide service and efficiency to your administration. And for the modest wages of %d gildar, your Empire's bureaucracy will become the model upon which others are compared.
UnitType.Backstory: A long, long time ago, Caste Chalbion fell to a bloody siege and all of its occupants were massacred during the investiture. Or so says the local lore which is well known to take liberties in recounting old tales, especially ones which originated several centuries ago. The truth is no one even remembers who the invaders were and while historians exploring the ruins will present their theories as facts, at the end of the day, they are only wild guesses. If only they knew that there is still one direct witness to the horrible events that transpired on that fatal day: Chamberlain Duster Chalbion. The castellan who still lords over his stony domain, who still administrates his charges long since turned to dust. Has he been cursed to remain forever behind or did his dedication to his liege extend beyond life itself? The administrator has kept a vow of silence for so long, content to hover over the ruins of the past. So what is pushing him now to volunteer his services to a stranger? Has he come to protect the descendants of his former sovereign or has he come to exact a revenge which has ripened for several lifetimes?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Rising from the bottom of the barrel will require a strong incentive.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of swimming in my own private ocean of heady ale. Don't start now, I don't care about judgmental peeps and squeaks. I'm a little low on copper, maybe you could pay me another round (%d gildar).
UnitType.Backstory: Soldier Rovelga didn't die in a blaze of glory fighting for the ideals of her people. Nothing of the sort, she only failed to survive her last drinking binge due to the gildar sized hole in her stomach. She was found lying crumpled behind the latrines, in a pool of her own vomit and still clutching her last tankard of cheap ale. She had never cared and appropriately enough, no one cared either when she passed away. Her body was unceremoniously dumped in the compost heap, left to rot in the open air. She woke up that night however, to the sounds of revelry coming from the mess hall and lumbered over there to share one last cup with the usual crowd of guzzling washouts. Which proves the saying that when alcohol is involved, a true drunk will always rise to the occasion.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The Bear that killed me found me unpalatable. Your foes won't find me any more appetizing.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of keeping the hunt alive even if I can no longer make that claim for myself. Oh yes I'll join in on your little kingdom hunting for %d gildar. Let's move it, the preys aren't gonna get caught by themselves you know?
UnitType.Backstory: Tanjera used to boast that she was the best Bear hunter in Elemental. A high claim indeed and impossible to verify for sure but she did have an impressive trophy rack before the pillagers came by. She was the one who trapped and killed Old Graymaw, a Cave Bear that had been using the Sheep Plains as his private pantry. Then she eliminated the huge monstrosity known as the King of the Mountain, courageously spearing the ursine underbelly just as the Bear was about to pounce for the kill. Her last hunt, on the other hand, didn't end so well. A standard Cave Bear from all appearances, it should have been easy to dispatch, like stealing candy from a child. Only this one refused to go down despite multiple lethal strikes, probably because it was already dead. Tanjera's exertions landed her far beyond the boundaries of exhaustion, her leg cramped and she fell to the assault of her attacker. Mangled, mauled and mutilated, she remained on the spot for several days, untouched by scavengers for none would sample that kind of meat. Tanjera rose on a crisp night to the sound of howling wolves, savoring the irony that in failing and rising, the hunter had now become the prey. For none would accept her now: an insult to all living things, a walking nightmare to be destroyed. Let the hunt begin!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The kiss of death was one of perfect ecstasy.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of stealing another kiss from my beloved Hoarfrost Concubine. I know she belongs to Vetrar but I would end my existence for another chance. Maybe you could help me find her? And for the small sum of %d gildar, I'll freeze anything and everything and turn your Empire into a permanent winter wonderland.
UnitType.Backstory: Walderon was born a poet, romanticizing the most mundane events as soon as he could string full sentences together. His nose always in a book, his formative years were spent in his grandfather's library keeping company to silverfish and mice while perusing the dusty tomes of the past. Reading through the journal of one of his great great uncles, Walderon was treated to the strange tale of the Hoarfrost Concubines, Old Vetrar's wives fashioned out of blocks of primeval ice and sent to the four corners of Elemental to undermine the influence of his Wildland cousins. Walderon was first intrigued, then fascinated, and finally became irremediably obsessed. To the point where he knew he would never be complete until he found one of those frozen ladies and stole an icy kiss from her. Leaving a hastily scribed note, he ran away from his parents' wealthy home and disappeared without leaving a trace. Many years later, a friend of the family who was ferrying goods through the treacherous trails of the Astegon Mountains saw him on top of a crooked outcropping, lording over the path like some Ice King of legend. The skin of the Frozen, the eyes of the Damned and the demeanor of the Walking Dead. The wind suddenly picked up, bringing a flurry a snow and he was gone. Out of sight and forever estranged from his past.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Nameless and faceless, I am the worthless soldier used as fodder to inflate the egos of butchers disguised as kings.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of reaching the end of my destination. Finally. And maybe discover the truth before that time comes. Why I have been the one chosen to suffer through this endless spiral of wars? Yes, I'll fight for you for the minimum wages of %d gildar, such is my destiny.
UnitType.Backstory: Do not waste any time asking the Lost Soldier who he was or where he came from. His only response will be to say that he's nothing but an anonymous grunt who fell on some battlefield during some forgotten war. And that he will always rise again to reenact the same cycle in a endless loop. He is the forgotten soldier, the one that rulers sacrifice without remorse to fight their petty wars based on imagined slights or dreams of conquest. The faceless nobody who won't even be given a proper burial, a feast for rats and crows once the dust settles. The wretch who never comes back home. The Lost Soldier who fights your wars, thanklessly.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Help me. Help me dissipate into nothingness. Help meeeeeeee!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of joining the rest of the dearly departed out this world. I'm dead -yes as in no longer alive- and I've got no business being still here. Kill me now! If you can manage to find a way to break my ghostly form, I'll join your forces. Oh and you'll need to pay up %d gildar, I may be naive but I ain't no fool.
UnitType.Backstory: In between wails powerful enough to level an entire village, you can discern - if you've got that special kind of ear that can decipher garbled gibberish - a few words tumbling out of Noremy. And if you're curious and reckless enough to hang a bit longer, you might reorder incoherence into something that makes a bit of sense. The gist: Noremy is convinced she was born without a soul and that's the reason why her essence remains stuck in the material plane, condemning her to the sad existence of a homeless ghost, a shadow completely adrift in a world where she doesn't belong. If she can't be wooed with promises of fame, glory or revenge, there is a chance she would consider joining forces with someone who could find the means to destroy her.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Even the Damned have their own Saints.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for the destruction of Life with a capital L. You see, it is my privilege as the Saint of the Damned and Condemned. Hmmm... I sense a power for great profanation stirring within you and for %d gildar, I could teach you how to sell your soul to the Netherworld.
UnitType.Backstory: Don't let the name fool you, Saint Egbert is no holy man. He's more of a vengeful spirit on a mission to spread misery, mayhem and vileness and will take as many lives as possible in the process. Driven by that special kind of hatred the Undead hold for those still animated by the spark of life, Egbert is attracted to war like a fly to honey. Appearing in the wake of great battles, he takes sustenance from blood and tragedy, soaking in the despair and anguish generated by the confused spirits of the slain. He cackles while draining lifeforces away, chortles when souls sunder from fatal suffering and sneers as he desecrates holy foundations. The foregone conclusion: Saint Egbert is a ghostly scourge with little substance.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of reintegrating my people, the Brood, and be reinstated in the service of my beloved queen. It's ingrained deep down. And yet, separation has brought another kind of exhilaration, independence in my thoughts and new found desires and aspirations. For %d gildar, I will put my spear at your service and we can explore this burgeoning potential together.
UnitType.Backstory: During his years of service to the Spider Queen as an elite bodyguard, Xagrixx distinguished himself with many feats of bravery, going so far as to impale an infamous Archmage right before her multiple sets of royal eyes. As a reward for such devotion, Xagrixx was chosen to become one of the few honored Risen Brood, those who continue their service to the Eight-Legged One even in the afterlife. Only something went dreadfully awry and the reanimation spell somehow got corrupted. The link with the Brood Pack was lost during a routine mission of reconnaissance. Xagrixx froze on the spot, his mindless packmates leaving him behind, executing their orders to pursue their patrol unquestioningly. As sentience reasserted itself, his thoughts regained their independence, making it impossible for him to reintegrate his patrol and even worse, his service to the beloved Queen. Now a pariah, Xagrixx wanders, trying to find a purpose, trying to fill the void brought by these strange ideas flowing and spiraling in his deformed cranium, trying to cope with selfish individualism where there was once only complete devotion to the collective Brood.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If my face might seem a tad unstable occasionally, know that my thoughts are always sharp and my decisions constantly sound.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of leading my troops to victory, without interference. I should have been a legendary general, not the laughing stock I've become. Damn Venedict! May his soul be devoured endlessly by the Ether Demons! My banner remains steady and proud and for %d gildar, I'll give you victory on a silver platter.
UnitType.Backstory: Before there was a General Clayface, there was a General Markonan who tried to convince King Venedict the Cruel that the battle to be fought on the Breadbasket Plains could not be won. It was pure folly, strategically unwise and would set their campaign back for months. Venedict ignored Markonan, interrupting his plea for reason with a dismissive shake of his hand. Several hours later, when Venedict's army was pulverized by those barely organized Urxen louts, his skin complexion turned from pasty white to beet red. Markonan knew to keep his mouth shut but nothing could have prevented that armored fist from landing in his face. And now comes the time to join in on the chorus: "General Clayface whose features were redone while on duty, has a split melon face made of putty."

EquipmentAbility_X_Shankvar Blood_Undead PathOfTheDefender ArmorProficiency2_Defender Ability_X_Defender1 Ability_X_Defender2 Ability_X_Resistance1 Spell_Barbs Spirit Talent_XM_BlackHole Ability_X_EreogsBox Ability_X_IsChampion Ability_X_IsEmpire Ability_X_IsHumanoid UnitStat_BG_IsImmortalAbility Ability_X_IsImmuneToFear Ability_X_IsMale UnitStat_BG_IsNotAliveAbility Ability_X_IsUndead 'Knock knock!' I thirst for a life of playing practical jokes of a deadly nature on the world. Those are the only ones that amuse me still, throughout the centuries. Your guys might enjoy my unique brand of humor too, I've got plenty of knock knock jokes to share. And only for %d gildar! Shankvar is a mean-spirited Poltergeist who elected to reside in a crumbling suit of armor. It is unclear whether they share a bond born out of the past or if this deteriorated shell has been randomly chosen as a permanent habitat. Shankvar speaks of better times, when his armor was in better shape, when he could haunt castles and play vicious pranks on night guards. Times long past indeed for he now looks as if he came straight out of the Scrapyard. His armor joints are in desperate need of an oil job and creak most unpleasantly; he leaves a trail of rust powder wherever he goes, an unintended invitation to be followed. What is the insistence to keep this battered relic? Could it be that he's stuck inside this piece of junk or that his very existence is intrinsically linked to it? "Knock knock" said the Poltergeist! Now is the time to run for it before your army gets wiped out by a flow of horrible puns. GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The names of the ones who condemned me to dishonor and shame have long since been forgotten. Now tell me, who gets the final grin?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of keeping this one actually! What started out in agony and shame changed into jubilation and pride. I shall ride for eternity on my faithful steed, participating in history's greatest wars and most of all, grinning forever. My skills are many and if you can shell out %d gildar, you'll have the privilege of seeing me smile on a daily basis.
UnitType.Backstory: Betrayal of trust, breach of duty and fall from grace. Sir Devenas Headstrong has been acquainted with all three and now suffers the consequences for eternity. Betrayal of trust for taking liberties with his King's royal treasury and for his indiscretions with the Queen. Breach of duty for failing to report on crucial missions due to excessive drinking and for beating helpless peasants on a whim. Fall from grace for reneging his knightly honor by partaking in revelry and debauchery. Yes, Sir Devenas Headstrong was a blight on chivalry and has been cursed to spend the rest of his miserable existence as a Hellknight, the punishment which awaits those who would stray from the path of honor and integrity.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It is up to the weaver to shape the tapestry of destiny, no matter the quality of the material at hand. Allowing destiny to ravel its own threads is foolish and unacceptable.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of regaining my rightful position in the minds of the people. A Lich Queen I am not. Tell me then stranger, why do I yearn to burn kingdoms whole? Does that make you ill at ease? I sense you hold the fate of this land in your hands and for %d gildar, I'll make sure your grip doesn't falter.
UnitType.Backstory: Shadia, the legendary Queen of Darland, whose kingdom was overrun by the Undead legions of Mardoban. When she was brought before the Ghoul Lord, he was instantly fascinated by this woman who kept her head high and her disposition cool despite her kingdom lying in ruin at her feet. He was in fact so enamored that he decided to keep her at his side for eternity. She would be the Queen of Mardoban, the Empress of the Damned and ultimately, the instrument of his downfall. Shadia the Lich Queen, now without a land to call her own, feels the great reawakening of the shards. The time for prophesies is past and gone, she must dance the dance with the Great and the Powerful of this land and take a hand at shaping Elemental's destiny once more. Or be the grain of sand which will provoke the ruin of yet another kingdom?
